should we use hemp as a main stable in the U.S.? 
 hemp is not a harmful drug it's bad nickname of being called weed is not true you could smoke a whole feild of hemp and get away with less than a head ache. hemp can be used for so many things such as paper and clothing and rope and even to the most radicalk state it can be made into a house if you dont believe me read the book "the house made by hemp" in this book it explains that hemp is so useful that it can be made in to almost anything. the hemp industry was shut down because off the manufacturing of nylon rope, the hemp industry was then illegalized and has stayed that way ever since.
 
 so if you havnt already gotten my side of the matter i do beleive that hemp should me leagle

post_info.post_title: should we use hemp as a main stable in the U.S.?

no one seems to be arguing my point so if no one writes or answers me i am going to close this debat in 3 days
 emoticon_confused emoticon_mad emoticon_angry :( emoticon_frazzled emoticon_xbouncer emoticon_rolleyes

Any drug has its side affects. In this case, in serious use such as "a whole feild" it could be deadly, and any form of smoking also creates complications.
 Like all drugs people should be free to do what they want.
 Hemp should not stand out alone as being able to become legal, while others stay illegal. Thats ridiculous.... 
 In this case legalizing drugs becomes a problem for communities, and people. 
 People - Well you've seen the commericals, it slows down your reaction speed and can kill people. 
 Community - In the family - second hand smoke. If you have a neighborhood where 60% all smoke it lowers the value of the neighborhood for some adults because they don't want to bring their kids up in that kind of enviorment.
 (Home value is something which I plan making a thread on later) 
 
 Hemp has harmful effects that I don't think you've taken into consideration....
 
 Thanks for reading this
 
 Always Stay Open Minded

 (Summary) "I'm not talking about the actual drug / weed. I mean just the plant to be able to be used for other things."

hemp was being used as a material for building rope and when the idea for nylon rope came along hemp was illeaglized
